meanings.sent1: She enjoys poeticising in her journal every evening.
meanings.sent2: The poet spent hours poeticising by the lake.
meanings.sent3: The cat poeticising on the windowsill seemed lost in thought.
meanings.sent4: Her words poeticising the beauty of nature painted a vivid picture.
meanings.sent5: The children were mesmerized by her poeticising of the fairy tale.

meanings.sent1: He was poeticising about love and loss in his latest poem.
meanings.sent2: The students were poeticising their emotions through art.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to be poeticising a morning symphony.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were poeticising a story of resilience and hope.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush poeticising the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To make something poetic in nature.
meanings.sent1: The sunset poeticising the sky with hues of orange and pink was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: She had a way of poeticising even the simplest moments in life.
meanings.sent3: The flowers in the garden seemed to be poeticising a dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His music poeticising the silence of the night brought peace to all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The old house was poeticising memories of a bygone era.
